name: S3 File Loader
description: Downloads and loads files from S3-compatible object storage (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

aws_access_key_id.name: aws_access_key_id
aws_access_key_id.info: Your AWS-S3 (or s3 compatible storage) Access Key ID

aws_secret_access_key.name: aws_secret_access_key
aws_secret_access_key.info: Your AWS-S3 (or s3 compatible storage) Secret Access Key

code.value:
import os
import boto3
from botocore.exceptions import ClientError
from pathlib import Path
from typing import List
from loguru import logger
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import (
    DataInput,
    IntInput,
    Output,
    MessageTextInput,
    BoolInput
)
from axiestudio.base.data.utils import TEXT_FILE_TYPES, parse_text_file_to_data
from axiestudio.schema import Data

class S3FileLoaderComponent(Component):
    display_name = "S3-compatible File Loader"
    description = "Downloads and loads files from S3-compatible object storage"
    icon = "cloud-download"

    inputs = [
        SecretStrInput(
            name="aws_access_key_id",
            display_name="Access Key ID",
            info="Your AWS-S3 (or s3 compatible storage) Access Key ID",
            advanced=False,
            value="AWS_ACCESS_KEY",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="aws_secret_access_key",
            display_name="Secret Access Key",
            info="Your AWS-S3 (or s3 compatible storage) Secret Access Key",
            advanced=False,
            value="AWS_ACCESS_KEY",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="region_name",
            display_name="Region",
            info="The region where your bucket is located (for S3)",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="bucket_name",
            display_name="Bucket Name",
            info="The name of the bucket",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="object_key",
            display_name="Object Key",
            info="The key (path) of the asset in the bucket",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="endpoint_url",
            display_name="Endpoint URL",
            info="The MinIO server endpoint URL (e.g., http://localhost:9000)",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="silent_errors",
            display_name="Silent Errors",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, errors will not raise an exception.",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Data", name="data", method="load_file_from_s3"),
    ]

    def load_file_from_s3(self) -> Data:
        try:
            # Prepare the S3 client configuration
            client_kwargs = {
                'aws_access_key_id': self.aws_access_key_id,
                'aws_secret_access_key': self.aws_secret_access_key,
            }

            if self.endpoint_url:
                client_kwargs['endpoint_url'] = self.endpoint_url
                client_kwargs['config'] = boto3.session.Config(signature_version='s3v4')
                client_kwargs['use_ssl'] = self.endpoint_url.startswith('https')
                client_kwargs['verify'] = False  # This is often needed for self-signed certs, use with caution
            else:
                client_kwargs['region_name'] = self.region_name

            # Create an S3 client
            s3_client = boto3.client('s3', **client_kwargs)

            # Create a temporary file to store the downloaded content
            temp_file = Path(f"/tmp/{self.object_key.split('/')[-1]}")
            temp_file.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

            # Download the file
            s3_client.download_file(self.bucket_name, self.object_key, str(temp_file))

            # Check file type
            extension = temp_file.suffix[1:].lower()
            if extension == "doc":
                raise ValueError("doc files are not supported. Please save as .docx")
            if extension not in TEXT_FILE_TYPES:
                raise ValueError(f"Unsupported file type: {extension}")

            # Parse the file
            data = parse_text_file_to_data(str(temp_file), self.silent_errors)
            
            # Clean up the temporary file
            temp_file.unlink()

            self.status = f"Successfully loaded {self.object_key}"
            return data or Data()

        except ClientError as e:
            error_message = f"Failed to download from storage: {str(e)}"
            self.status = error_message
            if not self.silent_errors:
                raise
            return Data()

        except Exception as e:
            error_message = f"An unexpected error occurred: {str(e)}"
            self.status = error_message
            if not self.silent_errors:
                raise
            return Data()

            error_message = f"Failed to download from storage: {str(e)}"
            self.status = error_message

                raise

            error_message = f"An unexpected error occurred: {str(e)}"
            self.status = error_message
            if not self.silent_errors:
                raise
            return Data()
